title: Balance suggestions! For free!
body:
How to go about it? No idea, really - but as a player who found S5 to be the most enjoyable season by far, I'm gonna give it a go anyways!

1. Remove all the keystones - balance around champions instead. Let us choose a 3/2/1 setup from minor runes from different rune paths. This should alleviate a good bit of the burst and cancerous playstyles - also make Zed actually have to land his abilities! :P And as a bonus, should make the game far easier to balance in the long run.

2. Remove Duskblade dmg addition, maybe replace it with something "visiony", due to later mentioned vision ward changes. Remove Stormrazor completely. Revert Essence Reaver changes. Balance accordingly.

3. Nerf pure tanks damage, but increase their survivability. Plenty of ways to do this healthily.

4. Lower plating gold some, and keep them the whole game. Possibly have plating on inhibitor and nexus turrets also. Should make the game longer, and have IE/ER + Zeal item upgrade be doable again on "standard" ADCs. Maybe radically buff nexus turret dmg.

5. "Un-buff" ignite.

6. Reinstate season 5 vision trinket upgrades and possibly boot enchants.

7. Slow down on the minions winning games please.

_____

Unsure of:

1. Shutdown gold - I had a game where we were at a 4k gold disadvantage, but then we got some lucky shutdowns and objectives, and we suddenly had a 3,2k goldlead within 5 minutes. Don't know if that's all that healthy tbh - but maybe spread the shut down out over "multiple" kills could help that.

_____

And a few pet peeves of mine I'd like see changed, but are not to be taken too seriously:

1. Nerf high mobility users some, please - high mobility while sacrificing nothing, damage/survivability wise is just stupid.

2. Nerf Akali's new shroud to regular stealth. Then balance around that - we dont need more frustration in this game.

3. Revert Malzahar completely and THEN "Annie" him instead.

4. Griveous wounds - can we just remove this crap, and rebalance problematic champions around that instead, as GW is the difference of those champions being OP or UP in the same game - why not the golden middle road?

replies.body: 1. Remove runes

xD while that's funny and true at times, I think if riot focused on adding more runes to the collection, rather than buffing perfectly balanced keystones like dark harvest, we'd have the variety riot claims we want, and no choice would be beyond overpowered compared to another choice of runes for your champ

So true.  Nothing but problems.

Really I think they could be balanced but the combination of THESE KEYSTONES and ANY ADDITIONAL RUNES is ridiculous.  They deserved to be massively watered down, or the keystones or non-keystone runes removed outright.

GW should NOT be removed.

I don't want to see Soraka, Vladimir and Mundo every game because their kits counterplay was removed.

Well if you think about this way: Those champs in any one game dictate the type of items their enemies will have to build, effectively removing versatility among item builds. If anything, it would be better to remove Grevious wounds and nerf ally/self healing so that players can have more choices to choose from - item build wise.

More like versatility is determinedby the decisions you make to handle those champions. You can choose to forego GW but you cant fight vs vlad or when you know soraka ult is up. Or you can choose to invest 800-1000 gold to reduce their survivability. Removing Grievous wounds would just result in players building the same exact items that they do in literally any other game they play. 

Its like saying remove tenacity and reduce cc in game to give more options of boots. The choice to build to weaken enemies' effectiveness is still a choice.

They would be nerfed accordingly of course. Having a champion be overpowered until you buy an 800 gold item is stupid anyway.  It's not like you can counter healing like you would damage or defenses. Lots of physical damage? Buy more and more armor, sacrificing something for it. It makes for an active choice. Lots of heals? Buy the 800gold thing if you are an ad damage dealers, bramble if you are a tank, morello if you are a mage. . And that's it. But there isn't really a point in creating a gw value to spread on multiple items for so few champions..
which would basically make any champ who is healthgain based useless since they'd be weak to start with, in stead of weak until you get an item that weakens them.

nerfed does not mean weak. Nerfs are aiming to make someone that is too strong BALANCED (healer would become too strong and would be brought in line, and be able to be balanced accordingly keeping in mid heal as their strong point).
 In the last period  most of healers have been strong because their damage was {{champion:8}}  or because of their lane dominance {{champion:267}} . You don't see Soraka, which her only purpose in the game IS healing, strong. Because gw exists. Reduce her healing and Nami still has 2 hard cc and a soft one, a damage buff and a mov speed buff and a teamfight changing ultimate. Reduce his healing and Vladimir still can oneshot your backline and debuff your whole team. Reduce her healing and Soraka has..a silence that can be avoided if you get a lucky time between ticks with a root that screams "get away from here before 
I can root you" and a hard to land slow? Heals should be something the champion is balanced around, not something you can negate (effectively negating a positive balance lever of the champion). I think it's the same reason magic resist is more effective against a mage that armor is against an adc: as much as I'm pissed about it, even if I can't one shot an enemy I can still aoe slow, root, shield my whole team and give vision from afar.. if armor negated an adc the same way mr can negate a mage you might as well pick Ashe every single game as evey other adc most positive balance lever (aka their damage) would be able to be negated.

No, you don't see Soraka strong because she's super-squishy, extremely hard to coordinate a team around, enchanters are in-general weak in the current gamestate, she has no reliable self-sustain, and her healing hurts her, making her even squishier.

It's not because of GW. Even with GW, her healing is still reasonable, she just dies once she starts using it.

If a mechanic has no counterbalancing lever to it, then you CAN'T have a champion entirely based around it, or else that champion just becomes passively overpowered as there's nothing the enemy team can do about it. That's why it's a problem that Riot's been making everything knockups lately. It reduces the enemy team's agency to respond to what your champ does.

But all of those drawbacks are there to counterbalance for her heals in the first place. If you give all those weaknesses to a champion as a cost for his main strength and than give a way to hard counter that very strength why would that champion ever be picked? Jinx (first that came to mind) for example is dependant only on damage. She is super squishy, immobile except for a very conditional ms buff and her only ccs are both hard to land and have a high cd. Yet she can be picked when you want a late game carry that deals huge amounts of damage. Because that's her strength, and it can't be ignored. It's balanced around the fact that even through resists you will still be affected by her high damage. Soraka heals may not be THAT bad per se, even though gw, but they become so when you consider all that she gives up for them (she SHOULD be an overpowered healer since she suffers from all this negatives for it. That's how you would balance her). For the rest of sustain champion their sustain could be reduced since they have other strong points  (or reduce the other strong point if it's wished they remain a strong healer).  Knock UPS are way worse imho than healing because no matter how strong healing is it can still be countered with burst. That's what I like less about gw I suppose: It reduces healing in the situation it should be strongest  (prolonged fight), still does nothing to alleviate the miserable experience of trying to poke down a sustaining lane opponent, leading to situations where it feels too weak vs situation where it feels overbearing. Anyway that's only my opinion as a shitty g5 but I enjoy discussing ^^

Then what would happen to the new top tier support {{champion:16}}? The best top laner in the game {{champion:36}}? Or the super-safe pick {{champion:8}}? 

Grevious wounds is a necessity even if you don't like it.

You're only focusing on the case where they're gonna be OP if we don't touch those champions after GW is removed. That's where rebalancing comes in - with the end result probably being a bit higher than with GW on right now, but a decent chunk less than with GW off...

There's so many knobs that can be adjusted to not make them unkillable monsters. ;) GW just either makes the OP when not affected, or "meh" with it.

Everything has counters. 

AP = MR
AD = Armor
True Damage = Health
CC = Tenacity
Regen = GW

 Changing numbers on something isn't going to change the fact that it completely removes the counterplay to Mundo's Ult, Soraka's Ult and W, Vladimir's entire kit and more. I understand what you're saying but it just wouldn't work because the healing would have to be so negligible that it wouldn't be enough to matter, if it was strong or even just decent nobody would ever want to fight them / wouldn't be able to win lane against them.

There's also things that counter those counters.

* MR = Void Staff or Magic Pen
* Armor = Black Cleaver or Lethality/Armor Pen
* True Damage vs Health = % Max Health True Damage
* Tenacity = Ornn's Brittle effect or Suppression/Displacement
* GW = Spirit Visage or Revilatise (Rune)

It's basically counters on top of counters, it's rediculous.

Lethality counters armor? Are we playing the same game?
Not talking about anything else btw, just wanted to point out that lethailty is useless against anyone who has at least one armor item.
I know that Armor beats Lethality but it's still a counter nonetheless (assuming someone doesn't buy a cloth armor at the very least).
properly balance healing in the first place instead of having a heal reduction gimmick like every game?

Healing champions would never be balanced if there wasn't a way to actually counter it. Removing GW turns all heal-based champions into stat-checking champions or gives them such little counterplay that they become best in class.

Except in every game, but league of legends, healing is balanced and doesn't have a counter (or the counter is unused because it's pointless, eg. Pokemon).

Healing is unbalanced in league because GW exists. Healing amounts are absurd before GW or shit afterwards. Champions, like Warwick, who actually have balanced healing, are completely fucked by this.

balance healing properly like every other game?
"Balancing Properly" is an oxymoron when it comes to League. You can wish it and repeat it until Udyr gets a new skin, but it won't happen.

Define “Properly”. The concept of “Balancing Properly” is vague to the point of uselessness, because proper balancing means different things to different people. In the case of healing, the idea of what constitutes proper balancing will be drastically  different between those who main champs like Vlad, Mundo, and Soraka; those who’ve never payed the champs and hate them on principle for being annoying and unfun to play against, and everyone in between. It’s why balancing a game with a giant player base  like league of legends is hard, because it’s borderline immpossible to satisfy everyone’s demands. 

Apologies for rambling, I just feel like the job of balancing a game is much harder than most gamers give it credit for.
I understand that. But no matter what happens, the people who aren't satisfied will complain the loudest and claim that it's not balanced.
I am intrigued, what do u mean by Annie him?{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

Annie was largely the same after the mage update, but with some slight changes - that's what I mean with "Annie" him; revert him completely, then move around the power some. 

I was a diehard Malzahar main before the rework, and I can honestly say I detest this rework with an intense fury. (Yeah, I'm looking at your RiotRepertoir, I hope you suffer from uncontrollable flatulation till you revert him...) 

The first iteration did nothing to alleviate Malzahars allegedly unhealthy playstyle (Again, according to Repetoir - meanwhile LeBlanc). The following changes and mini "reworks" just made him worse and worse, when compared to the "good old" Malzahar.

A lot of power was taken from Q/E/R base damage and AP scalings, and moved into boberts and that god forsaken "spellshield" Repertoir insists he must have, and to make it all worse, boberts, who now potentially is a huge part of Malzahars damage, are worthless in teamfights, as they were before the rework, essentially making Malzahar having only 3 useable abilities in a TF...

With Annie him, I'm meaning something in the likes of; 

1. Revert him completely, both abilities, HP, movements speed, etc etc.
2. Reduce AP scaling and base dmg on ult, so it's not a oneshot easy peasy combo button, and more of a lockdown with som dmg.
3. Maybe keep the new Q, it's less burst, but more to do in fights - so that's a washup between new and old.
4. Now change old boberts to actually have a 0.1/0.15 AP scaling, have them "inherit" his tanky stats - like armor, bonus HP, MR - along the offensive ones.

There - he's now easier to spot when he is powerful and when not (amount of boberts and the state of them, ie. when they go berserk), minions are somewhat usefull in TFs, and no spellshield means you can actually CC him, or interrupt his ult if you time your shit right.

I would really love if riot gave us more outplay POTENTIAL, not outplay BUTTONS like R on Karthus and Zed for example. R that buffs a champion or changes its playstyle is ok, but an ultimate ability that just kills you is not. Actually Zed is a bad example, you can just flash his abilities, but there are many champions that just click R and kill you (Veigar, Syndra). 

But champions like that are Akali and Irelia and we hate them. Mostly because they need a nerf and they are not getting it. Akali is banned in 60-70% of matches and Irelia is obviously too strong. Both are well designed, but poorly balanced. That nerf for Akali's W was actually pretty good and maybe she needs just a little bit extra changes and shifts in damage, so that she won't be banned as much.

I honestly think that Zoe, Akali and Irelia are well designed. Just balanced really poorly. Zoe does too much dmg from that W. E and Q are easy to dodge, but her W does a lot of damage and cannot be dodged. She also gets free stuff from it. Irelia is doing a lot of dmg and it wouldn't be that bad if her stun wasn't so easy to hit. She can place it behind her and then just jump to a dying minion and hit it perfectly. Nothing really difficult about that. With her skill set I would expect at least this ability to be difficult in use.
